author: yorickdowne
content:
As others have said: No impact on gas fees. Gas fees are not determined by the consensus algorithm, so whatever happens to gas fees is not related to the merge.
To reduce gas, start getting comfortable with rollups. That is Ethereumâ€™s scaling solution.

author: yorickdowne
content: Block times are fixed at 12s

author: yorickdowne
content: Each node processes all blocks. A single node is as fast as 1,000 nodes.

author: yorickdowne
content: Because Ethereum values individuals being able to run nodes, the block time and block size (gas limit) has been chosen so that even an RPi4 can keep up.

author: yorickdowne
content: More affordable tx are very important. Ethereumâ€™s vision is to do this through rollups, Layer 2s. Think Arbitrum, starknet, that kind of thing. These inherit the security of the Layer 1 base chain, to differing degrees depending on type of Layer 2. Side chains like Polygon not or not really; Optimistic rollups more so; zk rollups completely
